intro: Anthoshorea confusa, commonly known as the confused anthoshorea, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions in Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and small trees. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. Its leaves are opposite and elliptical, with a smooth texture and a slightly waxy surface. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Anthoshorea confusa is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
